Title: Messi dazzles as Miami beat Vancouver to win MLS title
Summary: Lionel Messi inspires Inter Miami to their first-ever MLS Cup title . Argentina superstar Messi provided assists for two goals and helped create another . Inter Miami beat Vancouver Whitecaps 3-1 to win MLS Cup in Florida .

Title: Liverpool humbled again by Leeds fightback for 3-3 draw
Summary: Liverpool humbled again by Leeds fightback for 3-3 draw on Saturday . Reds led 2-0 and 3-2 thanks to Hugo Ekitike’s quickfire double . The Reds were in control of the game for the first time in five years .

Title: Shettima launches N1b family business grant initiative in Akwa Ibom
Summary: Vice President Kashim Shettima launched a N1 billion family-based business grant initiative in Akwa Ibom State . He described the programme as a practical model for turning democratic promises into real economic empowerment .

Title: Torres hat-trick helps Barca down Betis to extend Liga lead
Summary: Ferran Torres netted a first-half hat-trick to help Barcelona thrash Real Betis 5-3 . Lamine Yamal and Roony Bardghji scored the other goals as the champions moved four points clear at the top of La Liga .

Title: Constitutional amendment bill seeks to create new 182 legislative seats for women
Summary: The Reserved Seats for Women Bill moves through the National Assembly . It proposes the creation of 182 new legislative seats exclusively for women . Nigeria is on the verge of one of the most consequential constitutional amendments in its democratic history .

Title: Use money for Rolls-Royce to build industries instead’, Dangote tells luxury car owners
Summary: Africa’s richest man, Aliko Dangote, urges wealthy Nigerians to channel funds spent on luxury cars and private jets into establishing industries that can create jobs and drive sustainable economic growth .

Title: Harrison Gwamnishu, family of abducted Edo couple in ransom controversy
Summary: Harrison Gwamnishu, a human rights activist, is embroiled in a ransom-delivery operation in Edo State . Fresh details have continued to complicate the online storm surrounding the activist . New assertions credited to his lawyer amid investigations into the operation .

Title: INSECURITY:Our leaders know the right thing to do, let them do it — Pastor Ituah Ighodalo
Summary: Pastor Ituah Ighodalo is Senior Pastor of Trinity House, Lagos . He is also the founder, African Leadership Group (ALG), a platform which seeks to inform and find solutions to the leadership problems plaguing Nigeria in particular and Africa in general .

Title: South moves against northern bandits
Summary: As bandits from the North push farther toward the fringes of the South, security anxieties have deepened across the southern corridor, stretching from the thick forests of Oke-Ogun in Oyo to the oil-rich creeks of the Niger Delta .

Title: Nnamdi Kanu’s new neighbours speak on ‘unusual prisoner’ in Sokoto
Summary: IPOB leader Nnamdi Kanu is currently serving his sentence at the Sokoto Central Correctional Centre . Tension is gradually building across Sokoto metropolis as residents struggle to cope with the presence of Kanu .

Title: Why past attempts to withdraw policemen from VIPs failed – Ex-IGP
Summary: Usman Baba said previous attempts to withdraw police officers from Very Important Persons failed because such directives were issued by police chiefs rather than by the President . He hailed the President for having the “political will” to order the withdrawal of policemen from private individuals and undeserving VIPs . The former police chief expressed strong optimism that President

Title: Tinubu's reforms yielding results, says Uzodimma
Summary: Imo State Governor, Hope Uzodimma, says Nigeria was in dire economic state before President Bola Tinubu assumed office . He said the administration’s reforms are now beginning to produce tangible results despite the hardship faced by citizens . His comments followed the conclusion of a two-day meeting of the Progressive Governors’

Title: Dangote to Nigerians: Stop buying Rolls-Royce, build industries
Summary: Aliko Dangote has called on the elite in the country to redirect funds currently spent on luxury items such as Rolls-Royce cars and private jets into establishing industries that drive economic growth and create employment opportunities . Speaking with our correspondents after a meeting with President Bola Tinubu at Aso Rock Villa on Saturday, D

Title: FG’s electronic transfer levy revenue doubles to N360bn
Summary: The Federal Government received N360.29bn from electronic money transfer levies between January and October 2025 . The amount was more than double the N170.92bn generated in the same period of 2024 . Proceeds from the levy are shared among the three tiers of government based on an approved revenue-sharing formula .

Title: APC's gain of more governors shows Nigerians' trust — Sanwo-Olu
Summary: Lagos State Governor, Babajide Sanwo-Olu, says the rise in the number of governors elected on the platform of the All Progressives Congress reflects Nigerians’ growing confidence in the ruling party . He said the rise from “barely 18 or 19” governors in previous years to 25 today shows that
